thread.title: Manchester United squad vs Wigan revealed ahead of FA Cup fourth round clash
thread.title_full: Manchester United squad vs Wigan revealed ahead of FA Cup fourth round clash

author: Jacob Murtagh
title: Manchester United squad vs Wigan revealed ahead of FA Cup fourth round clash
text:
Manchester United squad vs Wigan revealed ahead of FA Cup fourth round clash The Red Devils host the Latics on Saturday as Warren Joyce plots upset on Old Trafford return Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Jose Mourinho speaks ahead of crucial FA cup clash with Wigan Share this video Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Number-one goalkeeper David de Gea will be rested for Manchester United 's FA Cup fourth-round clash with Wigan on Sunday. 
The Spaniard is being given a few days off so Sergio Romero will start, but manager Jose Mourinho plans to name a "good team" against the Sky Bet Championship side. 
Eric Bailly is returning from the African Nations Cup after the Ivory Coast's early exit, while Luke Shaw is pushing for a first appearance since November 30 after being named among the substitutes at Hull. Read More David De Gea will be given a breather (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
Anthony Martial has not been in the previous two squads. 
The Red Devils will be looking to get back to winning ways after their unbeaten run was ended at Hull on Thursday night. 
Provisional squad: Romero, Pereira, Darmian, Fosu-Mensah, Valencia, Young, Rojo, Smalling, Jones, Bailly, Blind, Shaw, Carrick, Mata, Fellaini, Schweinsteiger, Herrera, Pogba, Lingard, Martial, Mkhitaryan, Rooney, Rashford, Ibrahimovic. poll loading Will Manchester United beat Wigan? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
